subject: Re: [junit] Re: Thinking of improving the auto generation of test cases
msgSnippet: Thanks Kevin. It would be great if you could send me the invitation. I am not sure that we need the license to try this out. If so, can you provide me a
messageBody:
Thanks Kevin.

It would be great if you could send me the invitation.


I am not sure that we need the license to try this
out. If so, can you provide me a temporary license or
a week or so?

Thanks and Regards,
Saldin

--- Kevin Lawrence <kev.lawrence@...> wrote:

> On 1/13/07, saldin samuel <saldin_s@...>
> wrote:
> > Hi Kevin,
> >
> > I have just gone through the demo and it is
> impressive
> > with the parameters of primitive data types such
> as
> > int, String, etc. How about generating the unit
> tests
> > for Objects such as class instances ?
> >
>
> The demo on the web is something of a toy to show
> how JUnit Factory
> works. To get the full experience, you should
> install the plug-in for
> Eclipse which has none of the limitations of the
> one-class-at-a-time
> web demo. You can upload and generate tests for
> entire projects. In
> fact, we use it to generate tests for JUnit Factory
> and the underlying
> engine - the Agitator - itself.
>
> We publish the results at:
>
>
http://www.agitar.com/openquality/dashboard-db/index.html
>
> > For instance, if my method is:
> >
> > public Student getFirstStudent(School school)
> > {
> > }
>
> We certainly can generate tests for methods like
> this. Download the
> plug-in for Eclipse and give it a try. I can send
> you an invitation if
> you'd like.
>
> Kevin
> www.junitfactory.com
> You send us code. We send you tests. For free.
>
